author: Prakash Kamat
text:
The Hindu Janajagruti Samiti (HJS), rightwing Hindu outfit on Saturday demanded stringent action against youths, participating in the Islamic State (IS) under the provisions of the crime of treason by declaring them as anti-nationals, instead of counselling them.

Referring to six highly educated ‘fanatics’ from Dhule, HJS spokesperson Sunil Ghanwat said that keeping in mind the poisonous ideology of the IS, there was no guarantee that the fanatics, who were totally under the psychological control of the IS would not return to terrorism despite any amount of education to deter them. It is also dangerous to the national security.

The HJS demanded a serious combining operation be launched at Dhule to find out the agents of the IS.
title: HJS seeks action against IS supporters
